did.unittitle: U.S. Women's Bureau "The Employment and Unemployment of Negro Women" Manuscript
did.abstract: "The Employment and Unemployment of Negro Women," from the U.S. Department of Labor Women's Bureau, July 1934.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of an 11-page mimeographed report, "The Employment and Unemployment of Negro Women," from the U.S. Department of Labor Women's Bureau, July 1934.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: U.S. Women's Bureau "The Employment and Unemployment of Negro Women" Manuscript #5029m. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The United States Women's Bureau (WB) is an agency of the United States government within the United States Department of Labor. The Women's Bureau works to create parity for women in the labor force by conducting research and policy analysis, to inform and promote policy change, and to increase public awareness and education. The Director is appointed by the President and confirmed by the Senate. Since its founding in 1920, the Director of the Women's Bureau has always been a woman. She is supported by a staff in the national office as well as ten regional offices.
